DRIED HERBS AND SPICES


Name Flavour Cuinse Additional
Asafoetida Garlic-onion Indian Loses body odur smell when cooked
Cardamom warm, aromatic Indian 3rd most expensive behing vanilla and saffron
Cinnamon warm, mild and sweet Indian, but everywhere desserts and savory dishes
Cloves Sweet, peppery and warming Indian
Coriander Earthy, lemony Indian background spice, goes with Cumin, toast before grinding seeds
Cumin Smoky, sweet and earthy Indian goes with chilli, cinnamon, coriander. toast seeds
Fennel seed Lightly sweet and licorice Indian
Mace subtle and delicate nutmeg (sweet, spicy) Indian Outter shell of nutmeg seed
Nutmeg Sweet and pungent, adds warmth to savoury dishes Indian
Star Anise sweet licorice-y Indian Can be used like Basil in tomato dishes
Turmeric mild woodsy, slight bitterness and astringency Indian used to round out other spices, yellow colouring
Bay Leaf woodsy flavor and slight bitterness Mediterranian Balances flavours
Caraway Seeds earthy, anise-tasting, pack a punch European
Paprika sweet note and a red color Hungarian Variable again
Saffron distinct but subtle floral flavor (freshly cut hay) and aroma Mediterranean yellow colouring
Cayenne Pepper sweet heat Mexican

FRESH HERBS


Name Flavour Cuinse Additional
Fenugreek bitter, burnt sugar Indian
Basil Highly aromatic with a robust licorice Asian add late to dishes
Chervil Delicate anise ? Do not cook, good with eggs
Dill Light and feathery herb with a pungent herb Asian
Majoram soft floral and woodsy
Mint strong distinct sharp ?
Oregano Robust, spicy, somewhat lemony Mediterranean/Mexican Variable based on origin
Rosemary Strong and piney, distinctive sharp Mediterranean
Sage Pine-like flavor, with more lemony and eucalyptus notes than rosemary Mediterranean
Tarragon Strong anise/licorice Asian
Thyme pungent, woodsy flavor Mediterranean
